top_categories.workout_context: Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego's technical rocky single-track alternating with forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 131 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
12,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
92ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
At mile 60 of 131, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
12,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego. Train it until it feels boring.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on technical rocky single-track alternating with. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Low-cadence force work for 12,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 12,000ft of climbing on technical rocky single-track alternating with does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego’s 131 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride technical rocky single-track alternating with sandy washes — sharp rocks destroy tires at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 131 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 131 miles of technical rocky single-track alternating with sandy washes — sharp rocks destroy tires in Del Mar, California.
